Literature Review: The integration of microfluidic systems into wearable devices has revolutionized the field of self-health care, enabling continuous monitoring of various health parameters. The development of wearable devices with microfluidic capabilities has opened up new avenues for the analysis of biofluids, including blood, sweat, and saliva. This review aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the recent advances in microfluidic wearable devices, highlighting their design strategies, sensing principles, and applications to different biofluids.
